p.s: In 2009, April 7 Barack Obama came to Turkey and joined a student's roundtable at ana university in Tophane.
His goal was to encourage young people to take part in intercultural exchanges.
He started his speech with the few reasons he came (ll. 1-3), being that he feels like it's of a high importance to regain the trust and peace that the US and Turkey had.
He talks about the young people in America that motivated him to find ways to create and form new bonds between them and other people all around the world.

Their activism, idealism and their deeply rooted wish for interaction with all kinds of humas (ll. 5-8), were the reason he tries to support opportunities to learn new languages or welcome students from other countries in the US (ll. 10-11).
He ends his speech with some motivational sentences (ll. 18-22) that are supposed to give the audience strength and hope for the future.
All in all he uses a language that's not totoo abstract to understand but his words still hold a lot of power and positivity.

He gives his goals even more importance, by saingsaying sentences like You can choose to build new bridges instead of building new walls (ll. 18-19) which emphasize the importance of intercultural understanding.
